titleproper.value:
Guide to the Karl Vogel Papers Relating to His Construction of a Model of the U.S. Frigate Constitution
                    <lb/>1924-1930
                    <lb/>
                    <num>MS 3030</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Larry Weimer

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2017-07-24T11:30-0400</date>

unittitle.value:
Karl Vogel papers relating to his construction of a model of the U.S. Frigate 
                <emph render="italic">Constitution</emph>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value:
The collection includes drawings, photographs, notes, and correspondence related to Karl Vogel's construction in 1927 of a one-eighth inch to the foot scale model of the U.S. Frigate 
                <emph render="italic">Constitution</emph>. The correspondence primarily includes letters, many with drawings, from Lieutenant-Colonel William F. Spicer of the Navy.

p.value: This collection should be cited as the Karl Vogel papers relating to his construction of a model of the U.S. Frigate Constitution, MS 3030, New-York Historical Society.

Gift from Karl Vogel, M.D., February 1967. Vogel's papers were donated to N-YHS as a complement to his principal donation, made at the same time, of the model of the 
                <emph render="italic">Constitution</emph> he constructed (likely accession 1967.8). The model was deaccessioned in June 2009.

Other reference material includes typescripts of letters written by Charles Edward Fleming on board the 
                <emph render="italic">Constitution</emph> in 1835-1837. There are also photographs of the U.S. frigate 
                <emph render="italic">Constitution</emph>, of a model of it, and of the 
                <emph render="italic">"Constitution</emph> as built for moving pictures." There are also three photographs of the U.S.S. 
                <emph render="italic">Constellation.</emph>
